channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Newington Gardens - dog waste bin overflowing, 12th June
item.description:
Waste bin in Southwark Council newington gardens dog area has been overflowing for two weeks, presenting a mess and health hazard

item.title: Gladiator street, 12th June
item.description:
It's very upsetting that we are lied to and told our street we are the tax payers fir a service we don't get, not ber cleaned in weeks and no one believes us. Dirty rubbish and empty bottkes blowing around esp after nin collection dsy. Pavements and herbs littered. Not acceptable but we are given e my uses that this will be inspected rather than swept weekly like we are told it woujd be and never happens! Disgraceful. We will now go to our local councillors- that we pay our council tax and a simple thing like keeping our pavements and kerbs clean and clutter free, we we say our pavements are not swept we are not believed, reply of our riload swept Mondays never happens! Hazardous for elderly, wheelchair users and chikdren, we have reported this many times and excuses and lies come after! Never a good clean! Unacceptable and illegal as we pay for a service that the council do not provide.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gladiator Street, Honor Oak, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No online payment for car park, 12th June
item.description:
I planned to park on May 30th and checked payment possibilities the day before on internet. Online payment was indicated as accepted. Arriving on the parking lot I tried to pay through RingGo app but I never received SMS (maybe because my phone number is french). I also tried to call the service to pay by phone but the server never recognized my car registration number (maybe because of my french accent). I had no change (reason why I checked online payment the day before) and was also in a hurry. I paid the resulting penalty of charge but I find the situation very unfair as I really had intention to pay for parking. Bottom line. Can you please indicate that online payment cannot work for foreigners. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Harrow Manorway, West Heath, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime trees overhanging pavement, 12th June
item.description:
The lime trees on Mays Hill Road (section near numbers 64-66 in particular) are overgrowing the pavement. When bins are out (see photos) there is little room for pedestrians to pass safely. Should be a quick and easy job to prune these back.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): May's Hill Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: We are still waiting for a camera for the LTN, 12th June
item.description:
Despite camera signs at one end of the LTN no one is fooled, 12 cars and 7 mopeds used the junction in the last hour. There is one particular moped that speeds along Clonbrock Road at least twice a day, this is an accident waiting to happen.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Nevill Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned works, 12th June

Masons hill near chicken shop These barriers have been here 3 days with no works

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 163, Masons Hill, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Dog poo, 12th June
item.description:
The rear of st Anthony’s Primary School on the Maple Road entrance from the corner of GENOA ROAD. Where the school has blue fencing a dog owner is not picking up the dog’s poo!! It is visible to everyone’s eye who walks their child to school and other pedestrians. There is also dried old dog excrement outside the same area that has sat untouched for weeks. There is fresh excrement outside number 12 Maple Road with flies buzzing around. The poo which is visible to everyone at the rear of St Anthony’s Primary school blue fence is not hard to find and it would seem the dog walker is bent on not cleaning up its dogs mess it’s awful. I would be grateful if this could be cleaned up it is a hazard.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole possible sink hole, 12th June
item.description:
Resident has said this was reported 3 years ago and nothing has been done. He now explains that this is getting worse and could potentially cause serious injury
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 89, Walton Road, Albany Park, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car abandoned for over 6 months with damage to front, 12th June
item.description:
The car has been parked there for over 6 months , it is taxed but it has damage to the front. No one has been to car in 6 months , clearly abandoned. Using up spaces for the people that live on the street.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Maberley Road, Elmers End, London

item.title: About 10 bags of rubbish dumped, flies now everywhere, 12th June
item.description:
I've reported this once already but about 10 bags of rubbish have been fly tipped on Craigerne Road about 3 days ago. Some of the bags are now ripped open and there are loads of flies everywhere. It's right across the pavement and really smelly and disgusting. Lots of children come this way to school everyday and it's not fair that they have to pass through this. Could it please be fixed? Really awful! Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Craigerne Road, Kidbrooke, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Betfred betting agents., 12th June
item.description:
Whilst we understand they have a contract for bin collections, they repeatedly leave excessive amounts of waste outside their property & as you can see from the photos, fail to clean up their mess when it's ripped open & strewn across the public highway.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 261, Bexley Road, Northumberland Heath, London
